intro: Chaerophyllum aquilegiifolium, commonly known as the water parsley or water hogweed, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of watercress. The plant typically grows in moist or aquatic environments, such as marshes and stream banks. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in wet, nutrient-rich soils.
